comments:

2. Click on "Web service type" drop down to show all web services type

Peter, back to you. Please investigate for 1.5.3. Thanks - CB.

Hi Kate,
   As I mentioned in my note to you the nested li, ul, and p elements in the info pop help files is causing sax parsing problem, which results in the whole info pop file being ignored and no dynamic help being displayed.  Therefore, I'm routing this defect over to you.  Thanks.
Pulled out nested elements in <description> tags. Tested it against the most recent 1.5.3 driver and everything appears to be working now.

Created an attachment (id=57864)
infopops with nested elements removed

Removed nested elements, updated copyright dates and plugin version #, minor text corrections (a few missing words were filled in)

Created an attachment (id=57866)
infopop with nested tags removed

Removed nested elements, updated copyright dates and plugin version #

Although this is a small change the nested tags in the dynamic help (F1 help) were preventing all infopops in the files (hundreds in total) from displaying. This should be resolved in 1.5.3 if at all possible since it's a large usability impact with very little potential risk since no other plugins are dependent on this one.
Released to head and 1.5 maintenance stream based on 2 +1 votes.
